chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zach Thomas Pfeifer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zach Thomas Pfeifer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zach Thomas Pfeifer was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Zach Thomas Pfeifer was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall complete upfront Compass Assessment and conditions of the Diversion will be per the Compass.

Defendant shall abide by all the rules of Probation & Parole.  The agreement may be revoked if the Defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Comply with any assessments, no contacts or conditions per agent.
